00019 #include <urbi/umessage.hh>
00020 #include <urbi/uvalue.hh>
00021 
00022 GD_CATEGORY(UMessage);
00023 
00024 namespace urbi
00025 {
00026 
00027   UMessage::UMessage(UAbstractClient& client)
00028     : client(client)
00029     , value(0)
00030   {
00031   }
00032 
00033   UMessage::UMessage(UAbstractClient& client, int timestamp,
00034                      const char* tag, const char* msg,
00035                      const binaries_type& bins)
00036     : client(client)
00037     , timestamp(timestamp)
00038     , tag(tag)
00039     , value(0)
00040     , rawMessage(msg)
00041   {
00042     while (msg[0] == ' ')
00043       ++msg;
00044 
00045     // System and error messages.
00046     if (msg[0] == '*' || msg[0] == '!')
00047     {
00048       type = msg[0] == '*' ? MESSAGE_SYSTEM : MESSAGE_ERROR;
00049       if (4 <= strlen(msg))
00050         message = msg + 4;
00051       return;
00052     }
00053 
00054     // value.
00055     type = MESSAGE_DATA;
00056     value = new UValue();
00057     binaries_type::const_iterator iter = bins.begin();
00058     int p = value->parse(msg, 0, bins, iter);
00059     if (0 <= p)
00060       while (msg[p] == ' ')
00061         ++p;
00062     /* no assertion can be made on message[p] because there is no terminator
00063      * for binaries */
00064     if (p < 0 || /*message[p] ||*/ iter != bins.end())
00065       GD_FERROR("parse error in `%s' at %s", msg, abs(p));
00066   }
00067 
00068   UMessage::UMessage(const UMessage& b)
00069     : client(b.client)
00070     , timestamp(b.timestamp)
00071     , tag(b.tag)
00072     , type(b.type)
00073     , value(0)
00074     , rawMessage(b.rawMessage)
00075   {
00076     switch (type)
00077     {
00078       case MESSAGE_SYSTEM:
00079       case MESSAGE_ERROR:
00080         message = b.message;
00081         break;
00082       default:
00083         value = new UValue(*b.value);
00084         break;
00085     }
00086   }
00087 
00088 
00089   UMessage::~UMessage()
00090   {
00091     if (type != MESSAGE_SYSTEM && type != MESSAGE_ERROR && value)
00092       delete value;
00093   }
00094 
00095   std::ostream&
00096   UMessage::print(std::ostream &o) const
00097   {
00098     char fill = o.fill('0');
00099     o << '[' << std::setw(8) << timestamp;
00100     o.fill(fill);
00101     if (!tag.empty())
00102       o << ":" << tag;
00103     o << "] ";
00104     switch (type)
00105     {
00106       case MESSAGE_DATA:
00107         o << *value;
00108         break;
00109       case MESSAGE_SYSTEM:
00110       case MESSAGE_ERROR:
00111         o << message;
00112         break;
00113     }
00114     return o;
00115   }
